00002  *
00003  * test.c: use async notification to read stdin
00004  *
00005  *  22/10/2008 - Start of porting the driver :
00006  * - from 2.4.x to 2.6.x
00007  * -  from VME to PCIGG 
00008  * 
00009  */
00010 #include <sys/types.h>
00011 #include <sys/stat.h>
00012 #include <sys/time.h>
00013 #include <stdio.h>
00014 #include <stdlib.h>
00015 #include <unistd.h>
00016 #include <signal.h>
00017 #include <fcntl.h>
00018 #include <sys/ioctl.h>
00019 #include "pscip.h"
00020 /*
00021 options
00022 
00023  exec name | letter  | number 
00024    t   any  ---> resets both IPs,      calles k_pscip_reset()
00025    r   any  ---> reading in loop from local_space_1 - do not work
00026    w   any  ---> nothing
00027    h   1  ---> resets IP A        calles IP_reset(pmap_address, 1);
00028    h   2  ---> resets IP B        calles IP_reset(pmap_address, 2);
00029    h   3  ---> writes to IP A "high prioroty write"   IP_write(volatile struct IPregister *pReg, u8 status, u8 address, u32 data)
00030    h   4  ---> writes to IP B "high prioroty write"   IP_write(volatile struct IPregister *pReg, u8 status, u8 address, u32 data)
00031    h   5  ---> writes to IP A "high prioroty write"   IP_write_2(volatile struct IPstruct *pReg, u8 status, u8 address, u32 data)
00032    h   6  ---> writes to IP B "high prioroty write"   IP_write_2(volatile struct IPstruct *pReg, u8 status, u8 address, u32 data)
00033    h   7  ---> reads from PFGA stat. reg, stat reg and interrupt reg IP_read_1(volatile struct IPstruct *pIP) -> mapping entire I/O, blank spaces included
00034    h   8  ---> reads from PFGA stat. reg, stat reg and interrupt reg IP_read_2(volatile struct IPstruct *pIP) -> mapping ONLY local space  blank spaces included   
00035    h   9  ---> reads from PFGA stat. reg, stat reg and interrupt reg IP_read_3(volatile struct IPstruct *pIP) -> mapping ONLY local space, no blank spacee      
00036    h   10  ---> reads from PFGA stat. reg, stat reg and interrupt reg IP_read_4(v) -> reading by shifting pointer and using inw() - rather not work    
00037    h   11  ---> reads from PFGA stat. reg, stat reg and interrupt reg IP_read_5(v) -> reading by shifting pointer to the IPregister struct 
00038 */
00039 
00040 
00041 
00042 pscip_t val;
00043 
00044 
00045 int main(int argc, char *argv[])
00046 {
00047  int fd, err;
00048  pscip_t val;
00049  int cmd;
00050  
00051 
00052  
00053  if ((fd = open("/dev/pscip", O_RDWR)) < 0) 
00054  {
00055   printf("Cannot open \n");
00056   return 0;
00057  } 
00058  
00059  printf("cmd: %c, val.chan: %d\n",argv[1][0],atoi(argv[2]));
00060  
00061  if (argv[1][0] == 'r') 
00062  {
00063   
00064 
00065   
00066   val.chan = atoi(argv[2]);
00067   val.stat = 0x0; // reading status register 
00068   
00069   val.address = 0x12;
00070 
00071   if ((err = ioctl(fd, PSCIP_READ, &val))) {
00072    printf("Ioctl error:in read\n");
00073    return 0;
00074   } 
00075   printf("ioctl() performed");
00076   
00077   
00078  }
00079  else if (argv[1][0] == 'w') 
00080  { 
00081   val.chan = atoi(argv[2]);  
00082   
00083   //sscanf(argv[7], "%3x", &tmp);
00084   //val.stat = tmp;
00085   val.stat = 0x80; // writing status register 
00086   
00087   
00088   val.address = 0x12; 
00089   
00090  
00091 
00092   if (err = ioctl(fd,  PSCIP_WRITE, &val)) { // PSCIP_WRITE , PSCIP_WRHIPRIO 
00093    printf("Ioctl error ii write:\n");
00094    return 0;
00095   } 
00096 
00097  }
00098  else if (argv[1][0] == 't') 
00099  { 
00100   val.chan = atoi(argv[2]);  
00101   
00102   //sscanf(argv[7], "%3x", &tmp);
00103   //val.stat = tmp;
00104   val.stat = 0x80; // writing status register 
00105   
00106   
00107   val.address = 0x12; 
00108   
00109 
00110   if (err = ioctl(fd,  PSCIP_RESET)) 
00111   { // PSCIP_WRITE , PSCIP_WRHIPRIO 
00112    printf("Ioctl error ii reset:\n");
00113    return 0;
00114   } 
00115 
00116  }
00117  else if (argv[1][0] == 'h') 
00118  { 
00119   val.chan = atoi(argv[2]);  
00120   
00121   //sscanf(argv[7], "%3x", &tmp);
00122   //val.stat = tmp;
00123   val.stat = 0x80; // writing status register 
00124   
00125   
00126   val.address = 0x12; 
00127   
00128 
00129   if (err = ioctl(fd,  PSCIP_WRHIPRIO, &val)) 
00130   { // PSCIP_WRITE , PSCIP_WRHIPRIO 
00131    printf("Ioctl error ii reset:\n");
00132    return 0;
00133   } 
00134 
00135  }
00136  else {
00137   printf("Error: invalid action type (r/w/a/t)\n");
00138   return 0;
00139  }
00140 
00141  close(fd);
00142  return 0;
00143   
00144 }
